content: Singaporean business executive (born 1983) **Shou Zi Chew** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 周受资; born 1 January 1983) is a Singaporean business executive who has been the [chief executive officer](/wiki/Chief_executive_officer) (CEO) of [TikTok](/wiki/TikTok), an online video platform owned by Chinese company [ByteDance](/wiki/ByteDance), since 2021. ## Early life and education Chew was born on 1 January 1983 in Singapore. His father reportedly worked in construction and his mother in bookkeeping. Upon graduating from [Hwa Chong Institution](/wiki/Hwa_Chong_Institution), Chew went on to serve [National Service](/wiki/National_service_in_Singapore) in the [Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces). After his military service, Chew went on to study at [University College London](/wiki/University_College_London) in England. He graduated from the college in 2006 with a [Bachelor of Science](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Science) in economics. In 2010, he completed a [Master of Business Administration](/wiki/Master_of_Business_Administration) degree at [Harvard Business School](/wiki/Harvard_Business_School), and while there completed a summer internship at [Facebook](/wiki/Facebook) prior to [its IPO](/wiki/Initial_public_offering_of_Facebook). ## Career After graduating from University College London in 2006, he stayed on in London to work as a banker for the Goldman Sachs Group for two years before he joined [Yuri Milner](/wiki/Yuri_Milner)'s venture capital firm [DST Global](/wiki/DST_Global). At the Russian investment firm DST Global, Chew led investment into [JD.com](/wiki/JD.com), [Alibaba](/wiki/Alibaba_Group), and [Xiaomi](/wiki/Xiaomi). He also led a team of early investors in [ByteDance](/wiki/ByteDance) in 2013. In 2015, Chew joined Xiaomi as its [chief financial officer](/wiki/Chief_financial_officer). In 2019, he became Xiaomi's foreign business president. In March 2021, Chew joined ByteDance as its chief financial officer. He subsequently replaced TikTok CEO [Kevin A. Mayer](/wiki/Kevin_A._Mayer), who left the ByteDance subsidiary after four months on the job. In March 2023, Chew testified before the [United States Congress](/wiki/United_States_Congress) regarding the legislative effort to ban TikTok in the United States. Following the testimony, then senator [Marco Rubio](/wiki/Marco_Rubio) requested the [U.S. Department of Justice](/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Justice) investigate Chew for [perjury](/wiki/Perjury). Chew testified again in January 2024, during a [United States Senate Judiciary Committee](/wiki/United_States_Senate_Committee_on_the_Judiciary) hearing regarding legislation on child internet safety. He was the honorary chairperson of the 2024 [Met Gala](/wiki/Met_Gala) as TikTok was the lead sponsor of the event. Chew was recognized as one of the most impactful Asians in 2024 by Gold House. In December 2024, Chew met with [Donald Trump](/wiki/Donald_Trump) at [Mar-a-Lago](/wiki/Mar-a-Lago) to lobby against a ban of TikTok under the [Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act](/wiki/Protecting_Americans_from_Foreign_Adversary_Controlled_Applications_Act). Chew was present at [Trump's inauguration](/wiki/Second_inauguration_of_Donald_Trump). ## Personal life Chew is married to Vivian Kao, a [Taiwanese American](/wiki/Taiwanese_American) businesswoman. They met as classmates at Harvard. - Shou Zi Chew on [TikTok](/wiki/TikTok_(identifier)) Portals: - Biography - Business - Internet - Singapore - Technology
